âœ… **Completed Tasks:**
1. Created Source/Core/MaskAtlas.h - double-buffered mask storage with atomic flip
2. Replaced Source/DSP/HopScheduler.h with Phase 4 version (bounded drain + flip) 
3. Created Source/DSP/RealtimeSpectral.h - RT-safe STFT/iFFT with OLA
4. Updated SpectralCanvasProAudioProcessor to use new Phase 4 components
5. Wired SpectrogramComponent to processor MaskDeltaQueue

**Key RT-Safety Features Implemented:**
- âœ… Zero heap allocations in processBlock (all buffers pre-allocated)
- âœ… Atomic page flipping for lock-free mask updates  
- âœ… Bounded delta draining (â‰¤16 per block)
- âœ… Single column copies only (NUM_BINS floats, never whole tiles)
- âœ… Denormal protection via ScopedNoDenormals
- âœ… Latency correctly set to FFT_SIZE - HOP_SIZE with assertion

**Implementation Summary:**
- **MaskAtlas**: Double-buffered pages with atomic flip, RT-safe column writes
- **HopScheduler**: Drains MaskDeltaQueue, maps timeâ†’column, manages MaskAtlas  
- **RealtimeSpectral**: Pre-allocated STFTâ†’scaleâ†’iSTFTâ†’OLA pipeline with hop FIFO
- **Processor Integration**: Added hop_ and rt_ members, wired in prepareToPlay() and processBlock()
- **UI Integration**: Connected SpectrogramComponent painting to MaskDeltaQueue

The core Phase 4 functionality is now implemented. The plugin should now support:
- Loading audio files â†’ progressive spectrogram display  


- Interactive brush painting mechanism for real-time spectral manipulation
- Instant audio feedback where visual mask directly impacts sound output

I'll track the mask modification workflow: when users paint on the spectrogram, each brush stroke generates precise column deltas. These deltas get atomically queued and transferred to the audio processing thread, which applies spectral attenuation in real-time. The result is an immediate "What You See Is What You Hear" experience, where visual interactions directly shape the sonic output with minimal latency.

content.text:
## Phase 4 (HEAR) Implementation Complete âœ…

**Core RT-Safe STFT Masking Pipeline Implemented:**

âœ… **Source/Core/MaskAtlas.h** - Double-buffered mask storage with atomic flip  
âœ… **Source/DSP/HopScheduler.h** - Bounded delta draining (â‰¤16/block) + timeâ†’column mapping

**RT-Safety Guarantees:**
- Zero heap allocations in processBlock (all buffers pre-allocated)
- Atomic page flipping for lock-free mask updates  
- Single column copies only (NUM_BINS floats, never whole tiles)
- Denormal protection + latency assertion (FFT_SIZE - HOP_SIZE)

**Data Flow:** UI Paint â†’ MaskDeltaQueue â†’ HopScheduler.drainAndApply() â†’ MaskAtlas.flip() â†’ RealtimeSpectral.processBlock() â†’ Attenuated Audio

**Ready for Testing:**
- Load audio â†’ paint spectrogram â†’ hear immediate frequency attenuation
- HUD should show drainsPerBlock > 0 while painting  
- pluginval --strictness 6 should pass with correct latency reporting

The core "What You See Is What You Hear" functionality is now implemented!
